feed.title: Debate: 64 bytes in OP_RETURN VS taproot OP_FALSE OP_IF OP_PUSH

entry.title: Debate: 64 bytes in OP_RETURN VS taproot OP_FALSE OP_IF OP_PUSH
entry.summary: In a Bitcoin-dev email thread, Russell O'Connor proposed that there is a point where it would be more cost-effective to use witness data instead of script pubkey. He suggested that a calculation could be made to determine this crossover point, which could be used to create a reasonable OP_RETURN proposal. However, Peter Todd disagreed with the idea of trying to argue a specific limit and suggested that users should decide for themselves how they want to use OpReturn.
